nodes.bodyText: This whole block seems the same as collect(File)
Right. Moving it to a common method.

How about the other collectors? Some return a static value (like the current date) and could trivially be extended to support URLs, e.g, CurrentDateExtractor.  FSDateExtractor could maybe use HTTP headers, though its name is a tad specific to FileSystems.
The others seem to be reading off GridCoverage, which I assume happens at a later step and is uniform, regardless
of the source of the raster (did you check?).

I didn't modified the FSDateExtractor since that one was specific for files on disk indeed.
Updating it to extract the info from the header.
The GridCoverage based are unrelated to the underlying source so I think they should work :-)
What happens if it's not?  Looks like it's going to NPE when setGranuleInput is called. Does it even make sense to have this with anything but a CogConfiguration?
I will update it to throw a runtime exception in advance.
Does it need to be public?
Mmm. nope. At the beginning I was thinking it being used by GeoServer but it's not true. removing public qualifier right now.

Hum... what if the source is a string, but looks like http://myserver/myfile?
Guess one could try to build a URL around it, and if succeeds, if the protocol is file, and/or try to build a File first, check if exists, and only later try the URL road.
Maybe? Wondering what happens with a plain file system path, without the protocol... would it be recognized as a valid URL? Maybe URL should be used only if the protocol is there, and it's not file.

actually the protocol isn't always being returned...
i.e. "/home/dromagno/test.zip" or "c:\myfile.zip"
k. I will go through the URL way ONLY IF protocol is not null and is not file.
harvestCollection and harvestURLCollection share some bits of code, maybe they can be factored out in their own methods?
Is this the only line different from fireFileEvent? If so, can you please factor out the difference and share code?
So are these tests going to run in some builds? PR checks? build server? Or just locally if manually enabled?
Also, I see code trying to handle a list of URLs during harvesting (one of the harvested resources). Is there a test for that case?

Yep. there is the online test checking it. (which was failing, bytheway. Fixed it)
I have also updated the timeMosaic test to harvest a List of 2 URLs instead of just a single one.
